meanings.definition: Make or become hard or solid.
meanings.sent1: The cold weather caused the water to solidify into ice.
meanings.sent2: After hours in the freezer, the liquid finally began to solidify.
meanings.sent3: I left my drink outside, and it managed to solidify into a block of ice!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed helped solidify her resolve to finish the race.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor used a special technique to solidify the clay into a beautiful statue.

meanings.definition: Make or become stronger or more certain.
meanings.sent1: The team's win helped solidify their position in the tournament.
meanings.sent2: Regular practice can solidify your skills and make you more confident.
meanings.sent3: His promise to always be there for me helped solidify our friendship.
meanings.sent4: The new evidence solidified the case against the suspect.
meanings.sent5: The support from her family solidified her decision to pursue her dreams.

meanings.definition: Make or become more definite or clear.
meanings.sent1: The meeting helped solidify our plans for the project.
meanings.sent2: Taking notes can help solidify your understanding of the topic.
meanings.sent3: His explanation only managed to solidify my confusion.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's example solidified the concept in the students' minds.
meanings.sent5: The map solidified the route we needed to take for our road trip.
